title: Product Comparison: GlowBoost Vitamin C Serum vs. DermaGlow Generic Serum

comparison_table.analysis: Product A is significantly more expensive, costing $249.0 more than Product B. This represents a 55.33% price premium for the GlowBoost serum.
Both serums utilize Vitamin C as their core active ingredient, suggesting similar benefits regarding antioxidant protection and brightening.
Product A uniquely contains Hyaluronic Acid, a premium ingredient for deep hydration and plumping. Product B uses a simpler, more common base of Water and Glycerin.
Product A offers a multi-benefit approach by combining anti-aging Vitamin C with powerful moisturizing (Hyaluronic Acid), potentially justifying the higher cost for comprehensive skincare.

summary: While both serums share the key active ingredient Vitamin C, Product A (GlowBoost) is substantially more expensive, priced 55.33% higher than Product B (DermaGlow). The price difference is likely attributed to Product A's inclusion of Hyaluronic Acid, which provides added hydration and skin plumping benefits not found in the simpler formulation of Product B.
